benchmark_details.name: CyberSOCEval
benchmark_details.overview: CyberSOCEval is a suite of open-source benchmarks designed to evaluate Large Language Models (LLMs) in Malware Analysis and Threat Intelligence Reasoning, which are critical tasks for cybersecurity operational effectiveness.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation of LLMs in cybersecurity tasks to improve model performance in supporting Security Operations Centers.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmarks are primarily multiple-choice formats, which may not perfectly simulate real-world tasks requiring open-ended responses.

data.source: Data generated from real malware samples and threat intelligence reports validated by cybersecurity experts.
data.size: 609 questions for Malware Analysis, 588 questions for Threat Intelligence Reasoning

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated as the percentage of multiple-choice questions answered correctly by the model.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in understanding and analyzing cybersecurity threats.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline accuracy for Malware Analysis is approximately 0.63% for random guessing, while for Threat Intelligence Reasoning is approximately 1.7%.
methodology.validation: Results validated through manual review and comparison to baseline performances.
